title: MY GAME WONT WORK/UPDATE HELP
body: My client keeps saying it cant update can someone tell me whats wrong?

replies.body: Thanks for the report guys.  I've seen quite a few reports this morning of players getting update failed this morning.  I'm looking to see if there might be something going on, but I could use more info as well.  When exactly are you guys getting the error?  Were you already patched to the updated client?  Was it during a reinstall?  This particular image is showing the legacy client, so I want to be sure.  Thanks in advance!
Watching the forums get flooded with patching issues and you see a ton of threads coming in https://youtu.be/z48NmdWbquw?t=48s

> [{quoted}](name=Nicuri,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=00030009,timestamp=2017-08-12T16:51:38.888+0000)
>
> Watching the forums get flooded with patching issues and you see a ton of threads coming in https://youtu.be/z48NmdWbquw?t=48s

+1
I'd hate to be 'that guy' but apparently, everyone is getting it by just being logged in. I was in a Discord call with multiple people when it happened.

Na, this is good info thank you!  I'm trying to get more info, but right now what I really need are folks to go through the the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to troubleshoot.  I've got a lot of players telling me they have a problem, but I've yet to have anyone tell me they've gone through the steps.  :/

That's because it's the epitome of bullshit-bingo attempts to buy time.

Update Windows: Irrelevant, if it were the determining factor you'd see people contradicting those reports here or on reddit due to varying patchlevels
Disable UAC: Irrelevant, because UAC would prompt you in case it intervenes
Run the game as an Administrator: Mostly irrelevant because if that were a solution, it would be public by now as many people try this automatically.
Check your Hard Drive for errors: That's a joke in a situation this widespread...
Reinstall the game as an Administrator: Several people have tried, no change for obvious reasons

Poor Porocles. I'm sorry that you have to be the one who gets dumped on with all of this.

I'd try and see if those steps work, but I can't get to a computer right now.

So, I'm just here for moral support. :D
I just got back from vacation last night, it's definitely a good way to get me back into gear.  :P   Thanks for the morale boost, hah!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=00030001000000070000,timestamp=2017-08-12T16:58:56.472+0000)
>
> I just got back from vacation last night, it's definitely a good way to get me back into gear.  :P   Thanks for the morale boost, hah!

Yo I want to tag you in a reply because people actually found a (temp) fix.

Set the date to the 10th or before manually on your computer. Loop gone, can log in. Just tried it and it worked.

I figure that might help you troubleshoot.

This is really strange.  Thanks for the info!  

(I've passed this on!)

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=0003000100000007000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-12T17:32:04.214+0000)
>
> This is really strange.  Thanks for the info!

Np, best of luck in fixing it quickly.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=0003000100000007000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-12T17:32:04.214+0000)
>  
> 
> (I've passed this on!)

Glad to hear it

Heads up, response I've gotten back is that this can cause more unforseen issues.  Because your OS and League uses clock sync, changing it can result in unforseen problems or issues getting into a game.  This is at your own risk, so please be wary about doing it!
hey porocles step one updating windows had no effect on the change but after i disabled uac and i ran as administator the game launched as normal! i hope this info helps you any
So when will this get a fix without us changing the clock sync or doing anything :V ?

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=0003000100000007000000000000,timestamp=2017-08-12T17:32:04.214+0000)
>
> This is really strange.  Thanks for the info!  
> 
> (I've passed this on!)

This also fixes the infinite looping. (8/12/17 bug)
it does work though

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2017-08-12T16:34:53.188+0000)
>
> Na, this is good info thank you!  I'm trying to get more info, but right now what I really need are folks to go through the the [permissions](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204134104-Setting-up-your-Permissions) guide to troubleshoot.  I've got a lot of players telling me they have a problem, but I've yet to have anyone tell me they've gone through the steps.  :/

I've seen a lot of responses to this and they all say nothing helped them

But nice job ignoring your replies and continuing to restate a non-working fix hoping for a placebo
No need to be an ass. It may not work, but at least they're trying to fix their side. Give them credit where it's due, y'know?
Some people don't know how not to be a jerk. My reply is snippy, but I've just woken up. I know they're doing their best. Shit like this just happens sometimes. Spaghetti Code things.
Yeah, but your reply was less... aggressive about it. It happens.

That's true. Idk why people have to be like that. Maybe he wasn't hugged enough as a child. 

{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}  (Seeing as Kappa doesn't work on the boards....)

You guys are bootlicking, they knew that the problem wasn't being resolved by the fix and they continued to tell people to go through a process that did nothing, Why have a public statement to people to take time and effort, and to mess with their security settings, time settings, and computer internals in general (Let's assume people don't know what they're doing, because as a company you should) when you know that it hasn't been reported to have fixed any problems but has been reported to have failed every time anyone responded

1) Riot's been saying not to piss around with your clock, and that it can lead to worse problems within the rest of your OS. Also, computer internals? You mean a dnsflush and an ip config? Oh man. So "internal".

2) Clearly you don't understand how coding works, because they may fix one issue in the code that's bugging out, and then 7 more pop up, breaking the game even worse.

3) 90% of the people complaining didn't go through the steps. Some people who did had it fixed, even though most haven't.

4) The fix Riot suggested was basically a more technical "Did you turn it off and then back on again?". You'd be surprised how often this works when trying to fix a computer problem.

~~5) Get the stick out of your ass.~~

Your articles or troubleshoot guides wont help us with anything. This isn't something wrong with our PC's I believe its based on you guys. It worked perfectly fine last night. Put my PC to sleep mode, turned back on this morning to play and this happened.

It could totally be on our side, and I'm looking to get more info on that.  In the meantime, selecting to not run through the permissions guide could be a missed opportunity for a simple fix and also not give our tech guys the information they need to investigate further.  Blindly submitting a report without going over basic steps would be really unhelpful for both players and technicians.

Everything is fine with me.
I did check for windows update and there was a little update. -> I did install it
Restart my PC 
But lol still stuck on 33% installing
opened cmd - > type "ipconfig/flushdns"
again did not work 
wait 
WOW
IT IS FIXED
--------------
I think you fixed it not me!{{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
It clearly wasn't you. Because it works for me as well and I didn't do any local troubleshooting (because it's useless on such widespread issues anyway)

ohhhh.... when I was in Q for ARURF it happened again...
sorry guys
I'm just useless

I've always wanted to learn how this stuff works. I LOVE information technology. If only I worked at Rito.. I've gone through the basic steps already, as you said,  Still seems to happen. At least you guys are trying! Keep up the good work! {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
Well seems like the permissions steps don't work :/

I got stuck in the endless repatching loop coming out of a game. Regular launcher would get stuck in the loop but tried lol.launcher.admin as admin and now im at 33%

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=000300010000,timestamp=2017-08-12T16:34:53.188+0000)

asides from reinstalling the client as admin from scratch, all the others steps are completed and still stuck in the loop of "There was a problem patching League of Legends. We'll restore a backup version and try updating after you restart the patcher" and "We have restored this installation to an older version of League of Legends. Now we'll try to patch it up to the latest version"

The client said it needed to restart to patch. After the client restarts a window pops up saying that the client has been restored to an older version. Afterwards it just repeats the same cycle of constantly restarting the client.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-08-12T16:31:19.392+0000)
>
> Thanks for the report guys.  I've seen quite a few reports this morning of players getting update failed this morning.  I'm looking to see if there might be something going on, but I could use more info as well.  When exactly are you guys getting the error?  Were you already patched to the updated client?  Was it during a reinstall?  This particular image is showing the legacy client, so I want to be sure.  Thanks in advance!

I was playing just fine earlier today.  

I come back from shopping, client still open (I leave it open pretty much  24/7 in case someone wants to message me), and I get a message saying it failed to update. Just, oh hey wonder what's going on League and see that there was some update that apparently failed.

It then starts the restart loop mentioned by others.

By the way, just a suggestion. Maybe make it so that you can click things -other- than restart. Idk, it seems like pretty shitty design to be blunt when I cant  A) actually click to exit out, forcing me to hit the exit button on the taskbar or use task manager (I should be able to hit the X on the top right corner), and B) actually even more impactful than nitpicking, have an option to click the gear so I can idk, maybe try to reinstall right there?

Seems like a pretty big oversight to me.

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=Nx1fzHta,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-08-12T16:31:19.392+0000)

Why should I go through this process when my settings were never an issue?
Fix the client and stop blaming us.{{summoner:14}}
I thought it was just me so I uninstalled League entirely, downloaded the game from the website now it says PVP Patcher Kernel not working.
While stuck in the patch loop, there is also an error message on the client where it states that it might be offline.
Someone fucked up.
same i dont know what the issue is

HERE IS THE FIX GUYS - https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/Khh6vj0A-fixing-patching-loop

Confirmed this fixed my issue, all I did though was sync my internet time.

Date and Time (setting in windows) > Internet Time > Change Settings > Update now

Fixed
This does work if you uninstalled league and tried to reinstall and you get the unexpected error thing
Just to clarify, the update now fixed my reinstall issue, changing to canada hour fixed my loop.
same, help us!
Riot i hate to say but you messed up your spaghetti client again. Please fix i was enjoying urf{{champion:1}}
go buy ARTPOP on iTunes solves the problem. {{item:3136}}
Man, why did i try to reinstall lol before checking boards, now i gotta download it for possibly no reason whenever it gets fixed :/
